statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Portland State 61, Idaho 59
article.story: MOSCOW, Idaho (AP) -- Six-foot-11 sophomore Scott Morrison made 15 points, including a pair of free throws with 4.6 seconds remaining, to help Portland State hold off a late Idaho rally and defeat the Vandals 61-59 in a nonconference game Saturday night. Josh Neeley chipped in 12 points for the Vikings, who improved to 3-6. Idaho, which received a game-high 24 points from senior guard Tanoris Shepard, drops to 1-6. The game got off to a particularly slow start. Neither team scored until Portland State's Keith Sconiers converted a shot at the 16:40 mark. Idaho didn't get on the board for another 2:22, when a Brett Ledbetter 3-pointer made it 4-3. Portland State picked up the pace, outscoring Idaho 17-6 to go ahead 21-9 with 5:05 to play in the half. The Vandals had closed the deficit to 29-23 at halftime. The Vikings made it 48-36 after a three-point play by Anthony Washington with 7:50 to play. Idaho closed the gap to 52-51 on a short jumper by Keoni Watson with 1:53 remaining. After Juma Kamara scored for Portland State, Idaho stayed at least three points behind until the final seconds, when Shepard made a 3-pointer from the top of the key with 0.5 seconds left.
